text.p: Scandinavian Airlines (SAS) has started regular passenger flights between Stockholm and the northern Russian city of Arkhangelsk, a company official said on Tuesday.
District manager Marek Pederson said SAS was running regular flights three times a week on a 110-seat McDonell Douglas MD-87 jet.
Arkhangelsk is the fourth Russian city, after Moscow, St Petersburg and Kaliningrad, to which SAS makes regular flights. SAS is the first Western carrier to fly to Arkhangelsk.
